dt: {bc}an attendant spirit of a person or place
{bc}a person who influences another for good or bad

dt.t: He has been accused of being his brother's evil {wi}genius{/wi}.

dt: {bc}a peculiar, distinctive, or identifying character or spirit
{bc}the associations and traditions of a place
{bc}a personification or embodiment especially of a quality or condition
{bc}a single strongly marked capacity or aptitude

dt.t: … had a {wi}genius{/wi} for getting along with boys …

dt: {bc}extraordinary intellectual power especially as manifested in creative activity
{bc}a person endowed with extraordinary mental superiority
{bc}a person with a very high IQ

pt: {sc}gift{/sc} {sc}faculty{/sc} {sc}aptitude{/sc} {sc}bent{/sc} {sc}talent{/sc} {sc}genius{/sc} {sc}knack{/sc} mean a special ability for doing something. {sc}gift{/sc} often implies special favor by God or nature.
{sc}faculty{/sc} applies to an innate or less often acquired ability for a particular accomplishment or function.
{sc}aptitude{/sc} implies a natural liking for some activity and the likelihood of success in it.
{sc}bent{/sc} is nearly equal to {sc}aptitude{/sc} but it stresses inclination perhaps more than specific ability.
{sc}talent{/sc} suggests a marked natural ability that needs to be developed.
{sc}knack{/sc} implies a comparatively minor but special ability making for ease and dexterity in performance.

et: Latin, tutelary spirit, natural inclinations, from {it}gignere{/it} to beget
shortdef: an attendant spirit of a person or place
a person who influences another for good or bad
a strong leaning or inclination : penchant
